physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Saccular aneurysm of the aorta with associated periaortic infiltration. Elevated F-18 FDG uptake within the walls of the aortic aneurysm suggested active vascular infection.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased size of the aneurysm noted on discharge, but decreased F-18 FDG uptake was observed one month after discharge, indicating clinical improvement.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient left the hospital in good condition with oral antibiotics. CT demonstrated increased size of the aneurysm.
Decreased F-18 FDG uptake in the right wall of the infrarenal abdominal aorta and periaortic space, correlating with clinical improvement and normalization of laboratory findings.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicated a more rapid response of F-18 FDG uptake due to successful therapy compared to delayed changes seen in CT morphology.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Nearly normalization of the F-18 FDG uptake.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No complications reported on clinical follow-up.
